metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9436 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
parsetagx.c in w3m before 0.5.3+git20161009 does not properly initialize values, which allows remote attackers to crash the application via a crafted html file, related to a <i> tag.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9436` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

w3m - 0.5.3-26ubuntu0.1
w3m-img - 0.5.3-26ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> same commit fix as for CVE-2016-9435

criterions.comment: w3m package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.5.3-26ubuntu0.1').
